subject: Sales
title: Consistency Builds Recognition
description: A micro-lesson that makes Consistency Builds Recognition usable.

hook.text: Coca-Cola's red hasn't changed in over a century. That consistency makes it recognized everywhere.

buildup.text: Brand recognition requires repetition. The same message, tone, and look must appear again and again.

discovery.text: Consumers need seven or more exposures before a brand feels familiar enough to consider trusting.

twist.text: Inconsistency confuses. Being professional online and sloppy in person blurs the entire brand message.

climax.text: Show up the same way everywhere: emails, calls, meetings, social media. Repetition builds memory.

punchline.text: Consistency isn't boring. It's how trust is built.

quiz.question: How many exposures does a brand typically need to build familiarity?
